org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver
Class ServerMessageToClient

java.lang.Object
  org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver.ServerMessageToClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
DatagramEncoder
Direct Known Subclasses:
ServerMessageToClientPingPong
public abstract class ServerMessageToClient
extends Object
implements DatagramEncoder

Provides a default DatagramEncoder implementation that returns an empty string. The encode() method implemented can be used (by not overriding it in sub classes) when only the message id is important (for example with Ping Pong messages, which have no content).

This class also contains a reference to the current ClientContext which will receive this message.

With this base class a message may encode itself to a String. This interface is used to translate messages into so called Binary Packets, or datagrams.

A response string needs to built up in the following format:
message id (3), encoded string

The following example could of a login response: 0052OK
The following example could of a pong notification:

Since:
1.0
Author:
Benny Bottema
See Also:
SwiftSocketServer.addClientMessage(ClientMessageToServer), SwiftSocketServer.getNextClientMessage(), DatagramEncoder.encode()

encode

public String encode()
Default implementation which returns an empty string. This is useful for messages that have no parameters, just a message code.

Returns:
